body: Same issue. Regression happened in 7.55.0. Removing `disabled={isSubmitting}` solves the problem in 7.55.0

Still reproducible on 7.57.0. After calling `form.reset()`, form can't be submitted unless fields are manually updated (all gets undefined, zod resolver). Also, `form.watch()` returns the reset button ref instead of current field values.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aec0552f-1279-4198-957e-de358283c8ac)

For now, I'm staying on version 7.54.2.

> I agree with @Jarzka‚Äôs opinion that ‚Äúthere should be no functional changes between patch/minor versions.‚Äù
However, at the same time, I find it a bit strange that when a field is intentionally reset with undefined, its value gets replaced with defaultValue ‚Äî even if this was the original behavior, it still feels a bit odd.

I agree with you that it feels a bit odd that resetting a value to `undefined` causes the value to be replaced with `defaultValue`. In fact, I have used the library for a few years now and I have always felt odd about this üòÖ But at the same time I have though it probably works like this by design.

I do not resist if this behavior gets changed, but since it has worked like this for so long now (and my project code depends on this behavior), I think changing it would have required a major version bump.
Thanks, guys, I will patch this. It shouldn't be `undefined`

@Jarzka Thanks for sharing your opinion! I was really confused when I investigated this issue. üòÅ
@bluebill1049 As always, I‚Äôm amazed at how quickly you respond, Bill. Truly respect your efforts. üëç
Thanks @candymask0712 for your investigation and help. I appreciate the support.
Users should have the option to define what the null/empty/undefined value is, adding an option to defined the preferred value would help.

issue.title: issue: Resetting array works differently between 7.54.2 and 7.59.0

labels.name: status: under investigation
labels.description: aware of this issue and pending for investigation

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: üìã React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
### Version Number

7.59.0

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

https://codesandbox.io/p/devbox/rhf-submit-default-value-754-forked-k4cf9w?file=%2Fsrc%2FApp.tsx

### Steps to reproduce

Hi

After [resetting a value to undefined](https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/12873) bug was fixed, I faced another issue when trying to upgrade the library.

Let's assume I have a form state which looks like this:

```ts
{
    names: [
      // Groups of "first name" and "last name" pairs
      ["seppo", "taalasmaa"],
      ["ismo", "laitela"],
    ],
  };
```

Then I reset it to this:

```ts
reset({
  names: [
    ["seppo", "taalasmaa"],
  ],
}, {
  keepErrors: true,
  keepDirty: true,
  keepDefaultValues: true,
  keepIsSubmitted: true,
  keepTouched: true,
  keepIsValid: true,
  keepSubmitCount: true,
});
```

What happens next depends on the library version used:

## Old version 7.54.2

- Go to https://codesandbox.io/p/devbox/rhf-submit-default-value-754-forked-k4cf9w?file=%2Fsrc%2FApp.tsx
- Click "Remove last item"
- The last item is removed and the new form state is `{"names":[["seppo","taalasmaa"]]}`

## New version 7.59.0

- Go to https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/rhf-reset-range-broken-5m424w?file=%2Fsrc%2FApp.tsx
- Click "Remove last item"
- Nothing happens and the form state is still `{"names":[["seppo","taalasmaa"],["ismo","laitela"]]}`

## Cause

It took me a whole day to debug this and also dig into the source code of React Hook Form. Finally, I found this loop inside `reset` function which "overrides" my reset values.

```ts
for (const fieldName of _names.mount) {
    const value = get(values, fieldName, get(_defaultValues, fieldName));
    if (!isUndefined(value)) {
        set(values, fieldName, value);
        setValue(fieldName, get(values, fieldName));
    }
}
```

RHF loops the form state field by field. It finds field `names.0` with a new reset value `["seppo","taalasmaa"]`. This is fine. Next, it finds field `names.1`. This field has no value in `reset` arguments (RHF thinks I'm resetting it to `undefined`), so it picks an old value from `defaultValues`, i.e. `["ismo", "laitela"]`.

However, what I expect to happen is that the value should be removed completely as `names.1` is part of top level `names` array which does not have it anymore.

```ts
{
  names: [
    ["seppo", "taalasmaa"],
  ],
}
```

Previously this wasn't a problem when values were reset "at once":

```ts
_formValues = _options.shouldUnregister
    ? keepStateOptions.keepDefaultValues
        ? cloneObject(_defaultValues)
        : {}
    : cloneObject(values);
```

### Expected behaviour

No functional changes between minor/patch versions, i.e. the expected output is `{"names":[["seppo","taalasmaa"]]}`

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### Relevant log output

```shell

```

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
